# The `Process` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

A collection of legacy interfaces for querying information about the current executing process. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::sys::Process</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

A collection of legacy interfaces for querying information about the current executing process.

Definition at line 43 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h">Process.h</a>.

### ColorNeedsFlush() {#ae688bc9ea544596962674ee94437ec00}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="static bool llvm::sys::Process::ColorNeedsFlush ()"
  labels = {["static"]}>
Whether changing colors requires the output to be flushed.

This is needed on systems that don&#39;t support escape sequences for changing colors.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h/#l00189">189</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h">Process.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### Exit() {#a38ee110d150d9b436e4d01405bd7f1a9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void Process::Exit (int RetCode, bool NoCleanup=false)"
  labels = {["static"]}>
Equivalent to ::exit(), except when running inside a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/crashrecoverycontext">CrashRecoveryContext</a>.

In that case, the control flow will resume after RunSafely(), like for a crash, rather than exiting the current process. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> 
<ul>
<li>NoCleanup for calling &#95;exit() instead of exit().</li>
</ul>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h/#l00216">216</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h">Process.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/process-cpp/#l00110">110</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/process-cpp">Process.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### FileDescriptorIsDisplayed() {#a2bd9c876be050d32ff622ef5b562bb4e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="static bool llvm::sys::Process::FileDescriptorIsDisplayed (int fd)"
  labels = {["static"]}>
This function determines if the given file descriptor is connected to a &quot;tty&quot; or &quot;console&quot; window.

That is, the output would be displayed to the user rather than being put on a pipe or stored in a file.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h/#l00150">150</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h">Process.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### FindInEnvPath() {#a2d23569135fe239b43594b6e8b99e67e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::optional&lt; std::string &gt; Process::FindInEnvPath (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> EnvName, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> FileName, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; std::string &gt; IgnoreList, char Separator=<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/#a77295e6c130654c888b57aa25f9f90c5">EnvPathSeparator</a>)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
This function searches for an existing file in the list of directories in a PATH like environment variable, and returns the first file found, according to the order of the entries in the PATH like environment variable.

If an ignore list is specified, then any folder which is in the PATH like environment variable but is also in IgnoreList is not considered.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h/#l00109">109</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h">Process.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/process-cpp/#l00039">39</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/process-cpp">Process.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### GetMallocUsage() {#aefb2b72e3e500a8b559e5d8c265b40e6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static size&#95;t llvm::sys::Process::GetMallocUsage ()</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Return process memory usage.

This static function will return the total amount of memory allocated by the process. This only counts the memory allocated via the malloc, calloc and realloc functions and includes any &quot;free&quot; holes in the allocated space.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h/#l00075">75</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h">Process.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getPageSize() {#a2b6f374dc4eb2a7f84cc346e5630e132}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static Expected&lt; unsigned &gt; llvm::sys::Process::getPageSize ()</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Get the process&#39;s page size.

This may fail if the underlying syscall returns an error. In most cases, page size information is used for optimization, and this error can be safely discarded by calling consumeError, and an estimated page size substituted instead.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h/#l00055">55</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h">Process.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getPageSizeEstimate() {#a774becf3d10728695b270703bca011ec}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="static unsigned llvm::sys::Process::getPageSizeEstimate ()"
  labels = {["inline", "static"]}>
Get the process&#39;s estimated page size.

This function always succeeds, but if the underlying syscall to determine the page size fails then this will silently return an estimated page size. The estimated page size is guaranteed to be a power of 2.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h/#l00061">61</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h">Process.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### GetRandomNumber() {#a92b058c34d04f6d0adf6eac3060343c6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="static unsigned llvm::sys::Process::GetRandomNumber ()"
  labels = {["static"]}>
Get the result of a process wide random number generator.

The generator will be automatically seeded in non-deterministic fashion.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h/#l00210">210</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h">Process.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### GetTimeUsage() {#ac44dcee71ca072093786da6b7d04149c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static void llvm::sys::Process::GetTimeUsage (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/#a52f2c3fdd7f80c1991d8c7079489efff">TimePoint</a>&lt;&gt; &amp; elapsed, std::chrono::nanoseconds &amp; user_time, std::chrono::nanoseconds &amp; sys_time)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
This static function will set <code>user&#95;time</code> to the amount of CPU time spent in user (non-kernel) mode and <code>sys&#95;time</code> to the amount of CPU time spent in system (kernel) mode.

If the operating system does not support collection of these metrics, a zero duration will be for both values. 
<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="elapsed">Returns the system&#95;clock::now() giving current time</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="user_time">Returns the current amount of user time for the process</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="sys_time">Returns the current amount of system time for the process</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h/#l00085">85</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h">Process.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### OutputBold() {#a5f838fbf3e04fdf7763b38ae5c499bbe}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static const char &#42; llvm::sys::Process::OutputBold (bool bg)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Same as OutputColor, but only enables the bold attribute.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h/#l00199">199</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h">Process.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### OutputColor() {#a17881ed9155bdf983b849c4c69c365b0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static const char &#42; llvm::sys::Process::OutputColor (char c, bool bold, bool bg)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
This function returns the colorcode escape sequences.

If <a href="#ae688bc9ea544596962674ee94437ec00">ColorNeedsFlush()</a> is true then this function will change the colors and return an empty escape sequence. In that case it is the responsibility of the client to flush the output stream prior to calling this function.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h/#l00196">196</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h">Process.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

This function makes the necessary calls to the operating system to prevent core files or any other kind of large memory dumps that can occur when a program fails.

### StandardErrColumns() {#a89927683c57b686c4694bbc0ee822653}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="static unsigned llvm::sys::Process::StandardErrColumns ()"
  labels = {["static"]}>
This function determines the number of columns in the window if standard error is connected to a &quot;tty&quot; or &quot;console&quot; window.

If standard error is not connected to a tty or console, or if the number of columns cannot be determined, this routine returns zero.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h/#l00168">168</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h">Process.h</a>.

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="static bool llvm::sys::Process::StandardErrHasColors ()"
  labels = {["static"]}>
This function determines whether the terminal connected to standard error supports colors.

If standard error is not connected to a terminal, this function returns false.

### StandardErrIsDisplayed() {#a30f5096a2364f58d967775a553c1143b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="static bool llvm::sys::Process::StandardErrIsDisplayed ()"
  labels = {["static"]}>
This function determines if the standard error is connected to a &quot;tty&quot; or &quot;console&quot; window.

That is, the output would be displayed to the user rather than being put on a pipe or stored in a file.

### UseANSIEscapeCodes() {#a6f01fd2553456500f600d83db62c6932}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="static void llvm::sys::Process::UseANSIEscapeCodes (bool enable)"
  labels = {["static"]}>
Enables or disables whether ANSI escape sequences are used to output colors.

This only has an effect on Windows. Note: Setting this option is not thread-safe and should only be done during initialization.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h/#l00184">184</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/process-h">Process.h</a>.
